name: XML Entity Blowup
description:
An attacker creates an XML document that with an external entity reference. External entity references can take 
                  the form of <!ENTITY name system "uri"> tags in a DTD. Because processors may not validate documents with external entities, 
                  there may be no checks on the nature of the reference in the external entity. This can allow an attacker to open arbitrary 
                  files or connections.
x_capec_example_instances:
The following DTD would attempt to open the /dev/tty device:
	<!DOCTYPE doc [ <!ENTITY ent SYSTEM "file:///dev/tty"> ]>
A malicious actor could use this crafted DTD to reveal sensitive information.
x_capec_prerequisites: The target must follow external entity references without validating the validity of the reference target.
x_resources_required: None: No specialized resources are required to execute this type of attack.
